column4: I am unable to write anything to my external USB HDD right now, it says it is a read-only filesystem. I used to be able to write to it (FAT-32 partition)
How can I fix this issue?
have you mounted it with the proper permissions?
it is automounted, as always.
the last time i used it it was fine, and now it is not.
hm, okay, from an entry in fstab?
no, just like with any other usb drive "magic" perhaps?
well, does "sudo mount -o remount -t vfat -o umask=0000,dmask=0111 /dev/whatever /mountpoint" work?
one sec
yeah, the dmask and umask are the important ones just now
that doesn't owrk, points me to a mount manpage
with what error?
no error message, there is a "USAGE:" part and then a "Now about Mount" part and then a refer to the manpage part
well, umount it, and drop the -o remount, i noticed we had two -o's
that I figured :)
eh, are you sure you're doing it right?
